instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
HI,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power that has no power.
It only has pulls 5V on 3 USB C ports, and consumes 0.40A on all 3 ports, but on another port the amp metter stays black, and i get 0V on F3001. Shall i replace the <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Check CC1/2 pins in diode mode for that port.
I suspect bad <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Hi,
 you were right.
It was the <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>.
Tks!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
After all, not everithing it's OK.
The mac already powers on, but is not charging the battery. Only works on charger.
What shall I check from here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Try known good battery first.
Is the battery recognized at least?
Be sure the big screw is tight and data cable is properly connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message: Tried with a good batery, but same result. Battery is recognized, but not charging.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power
threads.message:
Check voltage and diode mode to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.
Be sure <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> is pulled down; through <RESISTOR>R6950</RESISTOR>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q6955</TRANSISTOR>.
You can check with o-scope for activity on both sides of <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.
